title: Honor doesn't do as it was intended for
body:
Dear RIOT,
I remember when you introduced "Honor" to the game, and when this happened, it seemed like a great idea for reducing the amount of toxic players and trolls in game.
Unfortunately, after a long time playing with the honor system in place, the amount of trolls and the amount of toxic players has not reduced in my experience.
Here's why I think its not doing as it was intended to do:

There is no reward for being honored, except to have a "badge" or a title, or recognition for being honorable.
To an ignorant flamer or troll, having the title of "honorable" doesn't really mean much.

If you were to introduce some kind of advantage to being an honorable player you would see WAY MORE people actually wanting to behave in an honorable way, because there are actually in game advantages to being honorable.
Or some kind of REAL reward.

Here's a suggestion for a honorable player's reward:

* Free skin of the week. Just like free champs of the week, perhaps award a free skin or a number of free skins temporarily each week for players who have an honor badge.
Rewarding people with an icon is not enough, but a skin may be.

* The other possibility which would have a much more profound effect on people's behavior, would be to offer an actual in-game buff for honorable players. Nothing OP, but something that gives them an edge.

I'm aware RIOT mentioned they are "experimenting" with the idea already, but I haven't heard anything since this announcement...

replies.body: I still reckon anyone with an Honour Level of 0 (and perhaps even 1) should have Ranked Queue disabled for them.
